main event: A pilot reported observing a bright white, disc-shaped object with a bright green undersurface in Germany on 1 March 1963.
interesting points: The object was first observed at approximately 30 degrees and descended 20 degrees above the horizon., The observation duration was 20 seconds., The object was described as having no tail or trail and seemed to be in powered, level flight., The estimated brightness of the object was 2 to 3 times that of Venus., The sighting was made at night under clear conditions with excellent visibility.
sighted object: a bright white disc-shaped object with a bright green undersurface
witness description: pilot, copilot, and engineer of the aircraft
